page.title: 02The Shakkin Briggie
page.content: The Shakkin Briggie is a local bridge on the River Dee with an intresting background.It was constructed so that Cults people could make the journey to St.Devenicks Church. The proper name was Morisons suspension bridge but it became popularly known as the Shakkin Briggie.The Shakkin Briggie's funds to keep it in order ran out.It was left to rot and eventually the South side of the bridge collapsed. There is a fence to stop people climbing onto the bridge.The coucil saw that it was unsafe and took the planks out leaving only the main structure.There is only one quarter of this 19th century bridge left.
